Trees could move to different locations to access resources such as water and sunlight, potentially leading to increased growth and survival rates.
Trees could migrate to areas with better environmental conditions, potentially leading to the extinction of species in less favorable environments.
Trees could potentially form new ecosystems and habitats, leading to the evolution of new species.
Trees could potentially compete with other species for resources, leading to changes in the food chain and potentially leading to the extinction of some species.
Trees could potentially play a role in the formation of new landforms and landscapes, leading to changes in the geography of the planet.
